result.execSummary:
The defendant Joanna J. Lopes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
The defendant is to have no confrontational and/or agumentative contact with P. Lopes and/or J. Lopes as named in the complaint.

Defendant to complete an Anger Management Program tas deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joanna J. Lopes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Inmate Request to the Courts - DE is requesting that her payment plan by placed on hold - DE's payment plan will be on hold until 30 days after her release from custody

12:00 pm case called. Defendant Joanna J. Lopes in court with attorney Andrew John Sulewski.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on the record by DA Blader. Attorney Sulewski concurs.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 60 days WCJ, STAYED and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. CONDITIONS: Anger Management and follow through, as  deemed appropriate by the supervising agent, No confrontational or argumentative contact with P. and/or J. Lopes. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Joanna J. Lopes in court with attorney Andrew John Sulewski.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Sulewski requests plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 28, 2016 at 09:25 am.

Case called @ 3:42 p.m. Defendant Joanna J. Lopes in court with attorney Andrew John Sulewski.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Sulewski was recently appointed and is requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 09:25 am.
Status conference on May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 2:30 PM:  Defendant Joanna J. Lopes in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Def wants counsel and has not yet spoken with SPD.  Currently unemployed, on assistance.   NGP entered by Court.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
